name: The Westin Westminster

reviews.text: This was my second stay at this beautiful, friendly hotel. When you walk in the door you will be greeted by the enormous lounge filled with comfy leather and upholstered chairs and sofas, centered around a big fireplace. I just start to feel good immediately because of the warm colors and natural, "Western" feel. The rooms are similarly appointed, with the signature excellent beds. The shower is amazing, although the position of the towel rack at its rear is stupid.
reviews.title: Love it every time
Loved it!
reviews.text: Location is far from the Denver airport and downtown (although a shuttle only costs $32 round trip) but the hotel is right next to a movie theatre, Dave and Buster's, skating rink, mini-golf, brand-new bowling alley, and even a free public Frisbee-golf course and walking trails. The restaurant is mid to high in price (I've never been). While luckily the oyster bar isn't a Rocky Mountain oyster bar, for some reason two of the five types offered are from the east coast of the U.S. When I get hungry, I walk across the street to the Rock Bottom Brewery, where the crowd in the bar stays late and the beers are excellent and only $3.75.

reviews.title: Wow! Gorgeous hotel, terrific meeting facilities, outstanding service. Too bad its not in downtown Denver!
reviews.text: The main cons include a miniscule pool (though the workout center is big and extremely well supplied) and rapacious fees for phone and Internet usage. $2 to make a local call?!?!?! They do know the cell-phone has been invented, right?

reviews.title: Lousy Front Desk Service.....
reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin which is (surprisingly) rated at 4-stars. While the hotel itself was nice, the service at the front desk was terrible. They have no understanding of the concept of "customer service." Anyhoot, the rooms were nice but we found mold on the shower curtain, stains througout the carpet and even stains on our pillowcases. Housekeeping did not replenish any of the toiletries (like soap) until we requested it. We will probably not be staying at this Westin again.

reviews.title: What happened?
reviews.text: We stayed here on this visit because of a previous very good experience. This visit was completely different. We were booked for a room upgrade on a high floor. Didn't happen. The room we got was worn and dirty, surprising in a relatively new Hotel. Valet parking (which they charge you for) did not exist after 11pm. They still charge you, you just get to park your own car. Housekeeping was awful. Had to call twice in 4 days to get new towels. We called because the in room coffee maker didn't work. They brought a new one...and left it on the floor. The broken one was still in the bathroom, still full of coffee and water. We swapped them and the broken one sat on the desk for the duration of the stay. Honor bar was never checked/replenished. I could go on and on. Interestingly, my note to management was never responded too. I guess we will be searching for a different place to stay on our next trip to Denver.

Possibly the nicest, quietest hotel I've ever stayed in. Very nice bar, nice bathrooms.. mattress was a bit "saggy" in the middle. All in all, the best a hotel can possibly me. Furniture is very nice as well. You can take advantage of the hotel's transportation to and from restaurants (tip well, as we did).
reviews.title: Gorgeous Concierge, Gorgeous Hotel
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: Free coffee in-room, mini-bar nice (did not use). Cable for broadband access stored in refigerator. In-room safe perfect size for laptop and/or jewelry. I did not hear anyone or anything the entire stay. Elevators are tucked away from room hallways a bit, which means you don't hear "DING!!!!" throughout the evenings. And the concierge.. the most gorgeous woman I've ever seen, sorry to say. Nice lady as well.

The Westminster Westin is located between Boulder and Denver and is really a beautiful hotel. Our room was nicely decorated - very updated and cool, as was the rest of the hotel. We had 2 really fabulous dinners at the restaurant in the hotel and found the food excellent and the service very friendly. The hotel provides town cars for hire at reasonable prices which was a big bonus. The pool and gym area were beautiful and the gym was very well equipped.
reviews.title: Great hotel w/wonderful staff

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful time!!!

reviews.text: I recently stayed here for 2nights for business. The staff was very friendly and accomodating and the front desk clerk even made dinner reservations for us when we inquired about a good dinner location. The rooms are very clean and the furnishings are modern. The beds are comfy and the bathrooms were clean. There is a fridge and safe in every room. Parking was convenient and spaces were always available. The hotel restaurant is good and the service is very speedy, trying to be mindful of all the business travelers, etc. There is a pool and fitness room. The hotel is right next to an outdoor mall with shops and restaurants and only 2 minutes to the freeway. Also, this hotel is only about 10-15 minutes from Boulder. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Westin Quiet location close to fun

description: The Westin Westminster, located between Denver and Boulder, offers stunning Rocky Mountain views. In addition to a convenient location, we also have over 60,000 sq ft of indoor and outdoor event space
